title: News regarding FinCorp
story_body:
FinCorp Names New VP of Regional Operations

FinCorp (NYSE: FIN) announced today the appointment of Jennifer Martinez as Vice President of Regional Operations for the Southwest division, effective January 15. Martinez, who previously served as Senior Director of Client Services at the company's Phoenix office, will oversee operations across Arizona, New Mexico, and Nevada.

"Jennifer brings 15 years of industry experience and a proven track record of operational excellence," said Michael Chen, FinCorp's Chief Operating Officer. "Her deep understanding of our regional markets will be invaluable as we continue to enhance our service delivery."

In her new role, Martinez will be responsible for managing a team of approximately 200 employees across 12 branch locations and will report directly to Chen. She replaces Robert Thompson, who retired in November after 30 years with the company.

Additionally, FinCorp announced its participation in the upcoming Global Financial Services Summit in Las Vegas, scheduled for February 20-22. The company will host a booth showcasing its digital banking platform and recently launched mobile payment solutions. Three members of FinCorp's executive team are expected to attend panel discussions on topics including cybersecurity and customer experience innovation.

The company also unveiled a new marketing campaign titled "Banking Made Simple," which will roll out across digital channels and select markets beginning next month. The campaign emphasizes FinCorp's commitment to streamlining financial services for both retail and commercial clients.

As part of its ongoing environmental initiatives, FinCorp revealed plans to install electric vehicle charging stations at five of its corporate campus locations by the end of Q2. The initiative is part of the company's broader sustainability goals, which include reducing carbon emissions by 15% over the next five years.

"We're taking measured steps to reduce our environmental footprint while maintaining our focus on delivering value to shareholders and customers," said Sarah Williams, FinCorp's Head of Corporate Sustainability.

FinCorp, headquartered in Charlotte, North Carolina, operates 342 branches across 15 states and manages assets totaling $87 billion. The company's stock closed at $42.15 yesterday, up 0.3% for the day.
